title: add rustfmt and rust-toolchain files
body: Makes the project play nice with IDEs.

title: Update float_eq requirement from 0.7.0 to 1.0.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [float_eq](https://github.com/jtempest/float_eq-rs) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from float_eq's changelog.

[1.0.0] - 2022-06-02

Added some resource links to the documentation and promoted the crate to release version 1.0.0, as it has been stable for some time now.

[0.7.0] - 2021-10-03

Bumped up the version number since this release includes breaking API changes.

Changed

  • Derived types no longer have a default set of derived traits, use the newly added ulps_tol_derive and debug_ulps_diff_derive options to #[float_eq] to provide a list of traits to be derived instead.
  • The "derive" feature no longer requires the "full" feature from syn.
  • Separated out and clarified the documentation for implementing the various extension traits.

[0.6.1] - 2021-07-31

Changed

  • Clearer documentation for the FloatEqDebugUlpsDiff and FloatEqUlpsTol traits.
  • Updated derive tests to match current compiler output.
  • Switched to using github actions and codecov.io for continuous integration and coverage.

[0.6.0] - 2021-05-03

Bumped up the version number since this release includes breaking API changes.

Changed

  • Renamed many ambiguous uses of epsilon/eps/max_diff to tolerance/tol, which is the mathematical term of art.
  • Implementation of traits for arrays of any size using const generics.
  • Updated num-complex dependency to 0.4.
  • Reworked the documentation, added a tutorial.

Fixed

  • Safer behaviour when initialising debug output for array trait impls, including the removal of a source of undefined behaviour.

[0.5.0] - 2020-08-24

Bumped up the version number since this release includes breaking API changes to the extension traits.

Changed

  • Renamed FloatEqDebug to AssertFloatEq, and similarly FloatEqAllDebug to AssertFloatEqAll. This is to provide a more obvious link between these traits and the assert capability. The FloatDiff trait has been folded into AssertFloatEq both for clarity and because it is geared towards debug context and was not as general as the name implied.
  • Expanded rel checks into rmax (aka rel), rmin, r1st and r2nd to select which operand to scale epsilon's granularity to.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 6f4fdca Fix float_eq dependency on derive
  • 06216e7 Prepare for 1.0.0 release
  • 4c78143 Fix documentation
  • f80ce28 Added a bunch of links to resources.
  • 73f135d Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/jtempest/float_eq-rs into main
  • 2092565 Mention is-close in related efforts
  • 0056fe5 Merge pull request #22 from bcliden/minor_typo_and_link_alignment
  • 615f9f4 fix: typo in basic_usage.md, convert relative html links to md links
  • d66e8ff Removed redundant to_string call (thanks clippy)
  • bad2f20 Fix tests after changes in Rust 1.58
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: change trace to debug
body: There is only one `trace!` level log, so this might as well be `debug!` level.

title: make logs less noisy
body: The debug logs are very noisy if we include the tokens in the `NodeInfo` debug impl.

title: check_frame method
body: We have a use case where we only want to check that the frame length and version are valid before fully parsing it.

title: Update uuid to 1.0
body: This is a breaking change because uuid types are exposed in the public API

title: Generate batch QueryFlags at serialize time
body: similar to my other cleanups.

title: Move docs on BatchQuery::values onto QueryValues::NamedValues
body:
The warning only applies to the NamedValues variant of QueryValues.
I also left off the implementation details that the user doesnt need to know.

title: Remove BatchQuery::is_prepared field
body: The is_prepared field is duplicating state from the subject field.

title: Clippy fixes
body: Thanks for the release! Just fixing those clippy lints

title: Configuration of replication strategy parsing fix.
body: The `class` property obviously can't be parsed by `extract_replication_factor`. I fixed parsing, but it's still not type safe, maybe I make a few MR later.

title: Cleanup prepared metadata
body: Improves API by ensuring there is one source of truth.

title: Fix prepared statement result serialization
body:
The number of col_specs has no relation to GLOBAL_TABLE_SPACE flag, so I removed those asserts.
While I was touching this bit I changed the flags field to be generated at serialization time to make the API less brittle.

title: Fix bug in BodyReqStartup::from_cursor
body:
- A `[string map]` in the Cassandra protocol has [a short specifying it's length](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/8b15f8f22e8126f527ba0d39b9d13b20577c0192/doc/native_protocol_v4.spec#L261). I've modified the `from_cursor` method to read a short instead of an int.
- Add a test that exposes the bug that existed.

title: remove into_plain in favour of into_bytes
body: Both methods do the same thing so I have removed `into_plain` in favour of `into_bytes` as it is more descriptive to me. Happy to switch around though, or maybe just deprecate `into_plain` if we don't want to release a breaking change.

title: Update deps and fix some upcoming clippy lints
No metadata bug fix
body:
In the unit test, the test bytes didn't have the `GLOBAL_TABLE_SPACE` flag set and had a columns count of 0, which meant that the parser wasn't attempting to read any more metadata so this bug wasn't exposed. 

I've updated the unit test to have a column count of 3 so that if the `NO_METADATA` flag wasn't set, it would be attempting to read further metadata.

title: as_rust_type macro fixes
body:
- Fix some of the error messages
- Allow `Varint` to be converted into `num::BigInt`

title: Export get_wrapper_fn and add functions for wrapping collections
body:
- useful if you want to create `CassandraType`'s yourself
- All types are now convertible except for Custom.

title: fix CassandraType::BigInt
body: BigInt should be an `I64` not a `num::BigInt` type. Fixing that mistake.

title: Typed collections
body:
Adds the ability to parse a collection into usable types without knowing the type that the collection is supposed to be storing beforehand.

### An example of the usecase: 

#### Detecting we have a `List but don't know the type of it yet.
https://github.com/conorbros/shotover-proxy/blob/d51d063da82ade4828309e921848529892159cfc/shotover-proxy/src/message/mod.rs#L458

#### Parse our `List` with `CassandraType` enums into another type for our internal uses
https://github.com/conorbros/shotover-proxy/blob/d51d063da82ade4828309e921848529892159cfc/shotover-proxy/src/message/mod.rs#L595

#### Pattern matching our elements of valid Cassandra types into our internal type
https://github.com/conorbros/shotover-proxy/blob/d51d063da82ade4828309e921848529892159cfc/shotover-proxy/src/message/mod.rs#L562

title: Revert wrapping warnings in an Option
body:
I happened to notice today that Vec does not allocate when constructed with capacity 0:
* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/vec/struct.Vec.html#method.new
* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/vec/struct.Vec.html#method.with_capacity

This means that `Vec::new()`, `vec![]` and `Vec::with_capacity(0)` will all cause no allocations.

Because of this wrapping the warnings in Option provides no benefit.

title: Simplify Udt and Tuple new method
body: Also reduces allocations

title: Remove CStringList
body: Justification in https://github.com/krojew/cdrs-tokio/pull/59

title: Cleanup deps
body: Removes unused deps and updates outdated deps

title: Doc fixes
body:
- Fix a spelling mistake
- Add a link to the API docs

title: Make send_frame public
Ignore body in Frame debug formatting
body: Printing `Frame` with `{:?}` dumps the entire body to the logs and makes them noisy.

title: Remove CStringLong
body: Justification in https://github.com/krojew/cdrs-tokio/pull/59

title: Remove CString
body:
This PR improves:
* cassandra-protocol UX - users can directly use String types without worrying about cassandra implementation details
* speed - removes many allocations

Future work:
We will also want to remove CStringLong and CStringList but this PR is already large enough.

title: add from_buffer method to Frame
body:
This sync implementation is also useful for async applications that make use of https://docs.rs/tokio-util/0.6.9/tokio_util/codec/struct.FramedRead.html
In particular for implementing https://docs.rs/tokio-util/0.6.9/tokio_util/codec/trait.Decoder.html#tymethod.decode which is not async.

Unfortunately I couldnt see a good way to share code with the existing async implementation.
Possibly this should supercede the async implementation one day but for now I think they can just coexist.

title: Response encoding
body:
- removed frame auth success
- last of the response encoding work

title: Error encoding
body: Allow errors responses to be serialised

title: Result encoding
body: Serialise trait for `ResResultBody`

title: Remove BodyResResultVoid
body: This struct doesnt do anything, while i'm sure it gets compiled out in the end, it does make the code needlessly complex.

title: query params decoding
body: * I had to add `test_encode_decode_roundtrip_nondeterministic` because of the hashmap in NamedValues

title: Improve Value type
body: This makes the implementation and use of these types drastically simpler and removes an allocation when Null or NotSet.

title: Rename into_cbytes tests
body: Seems like this was left over from when `Serialize` used to be called `IntoCBytes`

title: Event serializing
body:
- Add serialization for event responses

More PRs incoming for serialising another types of responses.

title: Move protocol version selection to runtime
body:
The developer may wish to provide a configurable cassandra protocol version, this is impossible if the protocol is set at compile time.

* When deserializing a body the version comes from the frame.
* When serializing a frame I've tried to have the version come from a config struct in cdrs-tokio where possible but I think the API could be improved in the future.

title: Add frame encode/decode round trip test
body:
Adds test infrastructure that will be used for testing the encode and decode implementations which will come in follow up PRs.
For now just tests ResponseBody::Ready as that case already works.

title: remove unsafe usage
body:
Removes all instances of unsafe in the codebase:
* cursor_next_value implementation is invoking UB so I replaced it with the equivalent safe code:
    + As you can see in the `set_len` [safety section](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/vec/struct.Vec.html#safety-2) the old implementation is breaking the invariant `The elements at old_len..new_len must be initialized.`
       - We could possibly add a correct unsafe implementation in the future but I would expect benchmarks demonstrating a performance improvement before accepting it.
* The tests really have no reason to use unsafe, explicitly writing out the array works just as well.

title: Merge ks and table in ColSpec
body:
- Merge `ks_name` and `table_name` in `ColSpec` to a struct called `TableSpec` since they will either be both present or both absent.
- Convert the tuples in `RowsMetadata` and `PreparedMetadata` to use the same struct. Using a struct instead of a tuple lets them be accessed with field names instead of indexes.

title: Make invalid states unrepresentable in QueryParams
body:
By changing:
* with_names to be `bool` instead of `Option<bool>`
* removing the flags field (flags are now generated at serialization time)

we get a much better UX as many invalid states are no longer possible.

title: Split cassandra-protocol into separate crate
body:
closes https://github.com/krojew/cdrs-tokio/issues/40

I tried to keep this PR as simple as possible, if there are other cleanups needed lets put them in a follow up PR. (Unless they make this PR simpler of course)

title: add support for Yugabyte YCQL JSONB query result data type to fix the…
body: … add support for Yugabyte YCQL JSONB query result data type to fix the Unexpected Column type Error

title: Rename method
body:
The other builder method for adding a contact point is called `with_contact_point` so I renamed this one. 

For my usecase it would also be useful to be able to pass a `Vec<String>` of node addresses in and have them all added in one go. Let me know if you are interested in doing that in this PR.

title: Add no run to example
body: This example hangs when run with `cargo test`
